intro: Psychotria dingalanensis, commonly known as the Dingalan psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Philippines, specifically found in the mountainous regions of Luzon. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often in montane forests. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
